alert.note: Alert for Logan; Morgan; Washington; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 7:59AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Logan, Morgan, Washington and Weld. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 759 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Merino, Hillrose, Peetz, Logan Corners, Pawnee Pass, North Sterling Reservoir, Willard, Westplains, Padroni, Prewitt Reservoir, Snyder, Messex and Union.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
